alert.note: Alert for Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 17 at 4:52PM EST until December 17 at 6:15PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Horry County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 615 PM EST. * At 452 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported multiple road washouts near Conway. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Conway, Red Hill, Socastee, Loris, Hickory Grove, Adrian, Homewood, Nixonville, Horry Georgetown Technical College Conway Campus, Coastal Carolina University, Bayboro, Allsbrook, Hammond, Bucksville, Green Sea, Bucksport, Lighthouse Care Center Of Conway, Conway Medical Center and Loris Community Hospital. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Dangerous flooding from heavy rainfall can be expected, especially near poor drainage areas and other flood prone locations. It is harder to recognize flood dangers at night, as it will be difficult to determine the depth of the water. Roads may be damaged or washed away. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. If flooding is observed, then turn around, don`t drown.
